ğŸƒ 3-1 Bookaween Story Book â€“ Time to Make Your Page!

Hi 3-1!

It is time to start making your page for our Bookaween storybook for Halloween. Use the guide we went over today to help you.

Here is what to do:

Make your own page for your character.
Think about the other characters too so your page matches the story.
Write your part of the story clearly on your page so everyone can read it.
Use lots of color to make your page fun and Halloween-y!
I have attached the story to this announcement. Please feel free to change things and add your own touches. I want you to make it your own, but keep the story similar so the whole story makes sense.

We will have 12 pages completed by Thursday. After that, we can make the cover (page 1) and the back page together.

Canâ€™t wait to see your amazing pages! ğŸ–ï¸âœ¨

Extra reading

Please go to ReadWorks and complete some of the stories assigned. They will help you with you work in school and also improve your overall reading.

Go toÂ www.readworks.org/studentÂ 

Enter our class code YU6GQ2
Your password is 1234 unless you already changed it

Language Arts

Complete pages 58-59 in the Grammar workshop book.

https://www.sadlierconnect.com/anonymous/view-resource/gw?limitProgramTocIds=&productId=494&programSeriesId=3&programTocId=209&resourceId=287892&hash=dW5kZWZpbmVk

Math
The math test is on Thursday! The assessment pages in the book are very similar to what will be on the test. Tonight, we will work on the assessment pages in class. Tomorrow, we will practice by answering some questions on the board and explaining our answers to everyone. This will help make sure we are ready for the test.

Please have your child practice a little Khan Academy math each night
Â atÂ https://www.khanacademy.org/join/VK6QDS9EÂ to help strengthen their skills.
